Package me.dessie.dessielib.inventoryapi.inventory

Class CustomInventory<T extends CustomInventory<T>>

java.lang.Object
me.dessie.dessielib.inventoryapi.inventory.CustomInventory<T>
Direct Known Subclasses:
PaginatedInventory
public abstract class CustomInventory<T extends CustomInventory<T>> extends Object
Builder for creating Inventories with InventoryAPI.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    CustomInventory(int size, String name)
    Creates an empty Inventory with a size and title.

  • Constructor Details

    • CustomInventory

      public CustomInventory(int size, String name)
      Creates an empty Inventory with a size and title.
      Parameters:
      size - The size of the Inventory, should be divisible by 9 and no larger than 54.
      name - The name of the Inventory.

  • Method Details

    • updateInventory

      public abstract void updateInventory(int slot, org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack newItem)
      Abstraction method for updating an internal Inventory when changes are made to the CustomInventory.
      Parameters:
      slot - The slot that was changed.
      newItem - The new ItemStack that is in the slot.

    • updateBuilder

      public abstract void updateBuilder(int slot, org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack newItem)
      Abstraction method for updating the CustomInventory when changes are made to the internal Inventory.
      Parameters:
      slot - The slot that was changed.
      newItem - The new ItemStack that is in the slot.
      See Also:
      • setItem(int, ItemBuilder, boolean)

    • handlesInventory

      public abstract boolean handlesInventory(org.bukkit.inventory.Inventory inventory)
      Checks if the provided inventory is handled by this instance. For instance, if the provided inventory was created by this custom inventory and should therefore change to the Inventory should also change this builder.
      Parameters:
      inventory - The inventory to check handling for.
      Returns:
      If the provided inventory is updated by this instance.

      Parameters:
      preventClose - Whether the player can or cannot close the Inventory
      Returns:
      The caller CustomInventory type instance, for chained builder purposes.

    • addItem

      public ItemBuilder addItem(ItemBuilder item)
      Adds the item into the first empty slot into the Inventory. Returns null if the inventory is full.
      Parameters:
      item - The ItemBuilder to place into the inventory
      Returns:
      The ItemBuilder that was placed, or null if it could not be placed.

    • addItem

      Parameters:
      item - The ItemStack to place into the inventory
      Returns:
      The ItemBuilder that was placed, or null if it could not be placed.

    • setItem

      public T setItem(int slot, org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack item)
      Sets an ItemStack in a specific slot, regardless of if the slot is empty. Passing null as the item will clear the slot.
      Parameters:
      item - The ItemStack to add.
      slot - The slot to set the item in
      Returns:
      The caller CustomInventory type instance, for chained builder purposes.

    • setItem

      public T setItem(int slot, ItemBuilder item)
      Sets an ItemBuilder in a specific slot, regardless of if the slot is empty. Passing null as the item will clear the slot.
      Parameters:
      item - The ItemBuilder to add.
      slot - The slot to set the item in
      Returns:
      The caller CustomInventory type instance, for chained builder purposes.

    • setItem

      protected T setItem(int slot, ItemBuilder item, boolean updateInventory)
      Sets an ItemBuilder in a specific slot, regardless of if the slot is empty. Passing null as the item will clear the slot.
      Parameters:
      item - The ItemBuilder to add.
      slot - The slot to set the item in
      updateInventory - If the updateInventory(int, ItemStack) method should be called to reflect this change.
      Returns:
      The caller CustomInventory type instance, for chained builder purposes.

      slots - The slots to place the ItemBuilder into.
      Returns:
      The caller CustomInventory type instance, for chained builder purposes.

    • executeOpen

      public void executeOpen(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
      Adds the player as a holder of the inventory, and executes the onOpen(BiConsumer) consumer if it exists.
      Parameters:
      player - The Player to execute the open for.

    • executeClose

      public void executeClose(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
      Removes the player as a holder of the inventory, and executes the onClose(BiConsumer) consumer if it exists.
      Parameters:
      player - The Player to execute the close for.

    • addHolder

      protected void addHolder(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
      Adds a player to the holders list for this Inventory. Players should only be added when they have this inventory opened. If you manually add a holder, make sure it is removed by using removeHolder(Player).
      Parameters:
      player - The player to add as a holder.

    • removeHolder

      protected void removeHolder(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
      Remove a player from the holders list for this Inventory. If you manually added a holder to this Inventory, you will need to call this method to remove them.
      Parameters:
      player - That player that should be removed as a holder.
      See Also:
      • addHolder(Player)

    • getClose

      protected BiConsumer<org.bukkit.entity.Player,CustomInventory<T>> getClose()
      Returns:
      The BiConsumer that is consumed when the inventory is closed.

    • getOpen

      protected BiConsumer<org.bukkit.entity.Player,CustomInventory<T>> getOpen()
      Returns:
      The BiConsumer that is consumed when the inventory is opened.

    • getBuilder

      public static CustomInventory<?> getBuilder(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
      Parameters:
      player - The Player to get
      Returns:
      The currently open CustomInventory of the player

    • getInventories

      public static List<CustomInventory<?>> getInventories()
      Returns a list of all currently opened CustomInventories
      Returns:
      All opened CustomInventories
